intro: Impatiens thomsonii, commonly known as Thomson's impatiens, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture, while the flowers are borne in clusters at the tips of the stems. Impatiens thomsonii thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories.
